Description: Shoulder and body sherd of Attic red-figured pottery oinochoe; interior glazed streaky black; exterior: upper border of panel is a row of slanting palmettes with ovolo below; in right-hand top corner of panel, red-figure decoration consisting of a Doric column with architrave at an angle to the vertical border of double chevrons; relief-contour for capital, column, and borders.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Dr David George Hogarth
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0323) (Phase 1)
CVA Oxford I / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum Great Britain Fasc. 3, Oxford Fasc. 1 (p. 43, pl. XLIX, no. 9)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
